meanings.definition: A person who boasts or brags excessively.
meanings.sent1: The fanfarons at the party wouldn't stop talking about their achievements.
meanings.sent2: He was known as the biggest fanfarons in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The fanfarons in the office always had a story to tell.
meanings.sent4: She outdid all other fanfarons with her constant self-praise.
meanings.sent5: The fanfarons in the group made sure everyone knew about their accomplishments.

meanings.sent1: She would fanfarons about her new car every chance she got.
meanings.sent2: He tends to fanfarons whenever he accomplishes something.
meanings.sent3: The kids fanfarons about their video game skills to impress each other.
meanings.sent4: The politician continued to fanfarons about his policies during the speech.
meanings.sent5: The singer would fanfarons about her upcoming album to create excitement among fans.
